module.name: ObjectLists
module.short: Defines classes used to associate objects/pointers with objects/pointers

descr.p: Defines classes used to associate objects/pointers with objects/pointers. Converted to use generics by Juha. Item and Object types can now be defined.

element.name: T2Pointer
element.descr: T2Pointer is a record type used to maintain an association between the pointers to the members in the record.

element.name: T2Pointer.Item
element.short: Pointer to the item for the association

element.name: T2Pointer.Associated
element.short: Pointer to the associated item in the record

element.name: P2Pointer
element.short: Pointer to the T2Pointer record type
element.descr: Used to implement the list of item and object associations in TObjectArray.

element.name: TObjectArray
element.short: Implement an array of items with their associated objects

descr.p: TObjectArray is a generic type used to implement an array of items and their associated objects. TObjectArray allows the association to be defined using the TItem and TObj class types. Internally, it uses a list of records with pointers to the Items and Objects stored in the class. Properties and methods are provided to maintain and access the entries in the class instance, and the allocated storage for the array type.

element.name: TObjectArray.Get.Result

element.name: TObjectArray.Get.Index

element.short: Ordinal position for the requested object

element.name: TObjectArray.PutObject
element.short: Sets the value for the Objects property

element.name: TObjectArray.PutObject.Index

element.name: TObjectArray.PutObject.AValue
element.short: New TObj value for the property

element.name: TObjectArray.SetCapacity
element.short: Sets the value for the Capacity property

descr.p: SetCapacity calls ReallocMem to ensure that List contains enough memory for the number of T2Pointer instances specified in AValue. The Count property is also updated in the method (when needed) to reflect the new value for the property.

element.name: TObjectArray.SetCapacity.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TObjectArray.SetCount
element.short: Sets the value for the Count property

descr.p: SetCount calls SetCapacity when the new value for the property is larger than the existing value in Capacity.

element.name: TObjectArray.SetCount.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TObjectArray.Grow
element.short: Increases the storage Capacity for the class instance

descr.p: Grow increases the storage Capacity (number of item/object associations) for the class instance. Grow ensures that Capacity has a minimum of size of five (5). Otherwise, the number of associations is always increased by doubling the value in the Capacity property, which in turn, reallocates the storage space needed for the List.

Grow is used in the implementation of the AddObject and InsertObject methods. To avoid rampant memory consumption in large lists, caused by doubling the value in Capacity, explicitly set the value in Capacity to a reasonable size prior to calling the Add, AddObject, Insert, or InsertObject methods.

element.name: TObjectArray.Shrink
element.short: Decreases the Capacity and allocated storage for the class instance

descr.p: Shrink is a procedure used to decrease the Capacity (and subsequently) the allocated storage for the class instance. Shrink always halves the value in the Capacity property. It is called from the Delete method when Capacity has at least four (4) times the number of associations in the Count property.

element.name: TObjectArray.Add
element.short: Adds the specified item

descr.p: Add is an Integer function used to add the item specified in Item to the storage for the class instance. Add calls the AddObject method to store the value in Item. The associated object is unassigned (Nil) in the method. Use AddObject to store an Item and its associated object.
The return value contains the ordinal position in List where the Item was stored.

element.name: TObjectArray.Add.Result
element.short: Ordinal position in storage when the item was added

element.name: TObjectArray.Add.Item
element.short: Item added in the method

element.name: TObjectArray.AddObject
element.short: Adds the specified item and its associated object to the storage in the class instance

descr.p: AddObject is an Integer function which adds the specified item and its associated object to the storage in the class instance. AddObject calls the Grow method to increase storage in the class instance when Count reaches the value in Capacity.

AddObject uses the List property to store the values in Item and Associated to the corresponding properties at the position in Count. The value in Count is incremented prior to exiting from the method.
Use Add to store an Item with an unassigned associated object.
Use methods like Delete, Remove, and Clear to remove one or all associations stored in List.
Use the indexed Items and Objects properties to access values stored in an association at a specific position.

element.name: TObjectArray.AddObject.Result
element.short: Ordinal position where the association for the item and the object was stored

element.name: TObjectArray.AddObject.Item
element.short: Item stored in the association

element.name: TObjectArray.AddObject.Associated
element.short: Object stored in the association

element.name: TObjectArray.Clear
element.short: Removes all item/object associations stored in the List

descr.p: Clear is a procedure used to remove all item/object associations stored in the List. Clear sets the values in Count and Capacity to zero (0), and calls ReallocMem to set the allocated memory size in List to zero (0).
Use Delete or Remove to delete a single association by its position or item content.

element.name: TObjectArray.Delete
element.short: Deletes an item/object association stored at the specified position in the List

descr.p: Delete is a procedure used to deletes an item/object association stored at the specified position in the List. When List has a length greater than the value in Index+1, the Move routine in the System.pp unit is called to relocate any associations that occur after the position requested.
Delete decrements the value in Count. The Shrink method is called when Capacity is larger than four (4) times the new value in Count.
Use Remove to delete an association with a specific TItem class instance.

element.name: TObjectArray.Delete.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in List for the association deleted in the method

element.name: TObjectArray.Exchange
element.short: Swaps the item/object associations at the specified positions in List

descr.p: Exchange is a procedure used to swap the item/object associations in the List at the ordinal positions specified in Index1 and Index2.
Use Move to change the location for an item/object association, and reorder the List as needed.

element.name: TObjectArray.Exchange.Index1
element.short: Ordinal position for the first item/object association

element.name: TObjectArray.Exchange.Index2
element.short: Ordinal position for the second item/object association

element.name: TObjectArray.First
element.short: Gets the first TItem class instance in the List, or Nil when empty

descr.p: First is a TItem function used to get the class instance stored in the first association. First uses the List to access the T2Pointer stored in element zero (0) for the array.
The return value is the Item in the association cast to the TItem class type used for the generic class specialization. When Count contains zero (0), the return value is Nil.

element.name: TObjectArray.First.Result
element.short: TItem class instance at the first position in the List

element.name: TObjectArray.IndexOf
element.short: Gets the ordinal position in List where the specified TItem instance is stored

descr.p: IndexOf is an Integer function used to get the ordinal position in List where the TItem instance specified in Item is stored. IndexOf iterates over the storage in List in reverse order.

The return value contains the ordinal position where the T2Pointer.Item member and the Item argument contain the same class instance. The return value is -1 when Item is not located in the associations stored in List.

element.name: TObjectArray.IndexOf.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested TItem instance

element.name: TObjectArray.IndexOf.Item
element.short: TItem instance to locate in the List of associations

element.name: TObjectArray.Insert
element.short: Inserts a new association at the specified position in List

descr.p: Insert is a procedure used to insert a new association at the specified position in List. Item contains the TItem class instance for the association. The object for the association is always set to Nil in the method.
Use InsertObject to insert a new association using both an item and an object.
Use Add or AddObject to append a new item/object association.

element.name: TObjectArray.Insert.Index
element.short: Ordinal position where the association is inserted

element.name: TObjectArray.Insert.Item
element.short: TItem instance used in the inserted association

element.name: TObjectArray.InsertObject
element.short: Inserts an item/object association at the specified position in the List

element.name: TObjectArray.InsertObject.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in List where the association is inserted

element.name: TObjectArray.InsertObject.Item
element.short: TItem instance for the new association

element.name: TObjectArray.InsertObject.Associated
element.short: TObj instance for the association

element.name: TObjectArray.Last
element.short: Gets the last TItem instance in the List, or Nil when empty

descr.p: Last is a TItem function used to get the last item instance in the allocated storage in List. Last uses the value in Count to determine the position for the last item/object association. When Count is zero (0), the List is empty and the return value is set to Nil.

element.name: TObjectArray.Last.Result
element.short: TItem instance stored at the last position in List

element.name: TObjectArray.Move
element.short: Relocates the association stored at the position in CurIndex to the position in NewIndex

descr.p: Move is a procedure used to relocate the association stored at the position in CurIndex to the position in NewIndex. No actions are performed in the method when CurIndex and Index contain the same value.

Move gets the T2Pointer stored at the position in CurIndex from the List. Move call the Move routine in the System.pp unit to relocate any associations stored between the positions in CurIndex and NewIndex. The relocated associations are moved towards the end of List when CurIndex is greater than NewIndex.
The T2Pointer is reassigned to the position in NewIndex.

element.name: TObjectArray.Move.CurIndex
element.short: Ordinal position where the association is currently stored

element.name: TObjectArray.Move.NewIndex
element.short: Ordinal position where the association is moved

element.name: TObjectArray.Assign
element.short: Assigns TItem class instances specified in SrcList to the List storage in the class

descr.p: Assign is a procedure used to stored TItem class instances in SrcList to the List storage for the class. Assign calls the Clear method to remove all existing item/object associations stored in List.

Assign sets the the value in Count to the the length in SrcList. The method iterates over the values in the TList instance, and stores the TItem instances in the corresponding positions in List. The associated object for all entries in List is unassigned (Nil).

element.name: TObjectArray.Assign.SrcList
element.short: TList with the TItem class instances stored in the method

element.name: TObjectArray.Remove
element.short: Removes the association with the specified TItem class instance

descr.p: Remove is an Integer function used to delete the item/object association with the specified TItem class instance. The return value contains the result returned from IndexOf. The return value is -1 when Item is not found in List. When Item exists in List, the Delete method is called to remove the association at the position in the return value.

element.name: TObjectArray.Remove.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the association removed in the method

element.name: TObjectArray.Remove.Item
element.short: TItem class instance to locate in the List

element.name: TObjectArray.Pack
element.short: Removes all associations where the Item class instance is unassigned (contains Nil)

descr.p: Pack is a procedure used to remove all associations where the Item class instance is unassigned (contains Nil). Pack iterates over the allocated storage in List to determine if the T2Pointer.Item member is unassigned. When an an unassigned item is found, subsequent associations are moved into the storage position(s) for any unused items. Pack updates the value in the Count property to reflect the new number of associations in List.

element.name: TObjectArray.Capacity
element.short: Specifies the number of associations that can be stored in the List

descr.p: Capacity is an Integer property which specifies the number of item/object associations that can be stored in the List. Changing the value in Capacity causes the memory in List to be reallocated to accommodate the new capacity value. The value in Count may also be affected when the value in Capacity is reduced.

element.name: TObjectArray.Count
element.short: Number of item/object associations currently stored in the List

descr.p: Count is an Integer property which indicates the number of item/object associations currently stored in the List. Changing the value in Count causes Capacity to be updated when Count exceeds the value in Capacity.
The value in Count is maintained in method which add or remove item/object associations in List, such as: Add, AddObject, Insert, InsertObject, Delete, Remove, Clear and Pack.

element.name: TObjectArray.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to the TItem class instances stored in the List

descr.p: Items is an indexed property which provides access to the TItem class instances stored in the List.

element.name: TObjectArray.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested value

element.name: TObjectArray.Objects
element.short: Provides indexed access to the TObj class instances stored in the List

descr.p: Objects is an indexed property used to provide access to the TObj class instances stored in the List.

element.name: TObjectArray.Objects.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested value

element.name: TObjectArray.List
element.short: Provides access to the list which implements the storage for the item/object associations in the class instance

descr.p: List is a read-only P2Pointer property which provides access to the list which implements the storage for the class instance. It is organized as pointers to a sequence of T2Pointer records.
